abstract: General Motors says an initial public offering is a chance for the government to sell its shares in the company and help G.M. look more attractive to investors.
snippet: General Motors says an initial public offering is a chance for the government to sell its shares in the company and help G.M. look more attractive to investors.
lead_paragraph: 7:33 p.m. | Updated Eager to shed his company’s stigma of being government-owned, the chief executive of General Motors, Edward E. Whitacre Jr., said Thursday that G.M. wanted Washington to sell its entire stake during an initial public offering, The New York Times’s Nick Bunkley reports from Traverse City, Mich.

headline.main: G.M. Pushes for U.S. to Sell Entire Stake at I.P.O.
